# sleepy-tetris-

Sleepy tetris was inspired by the findings that link better sleep to tetris, this has been mentioned in a few books and articles I have read such as 'Tools of Titans' and 'Reality is Broken'. 

Articles can be found here:
'Can Playing the Computer Game ‘‘Tetris’’ Reduce the Build-Up of Flashbacks for Trauma? A Proposal from Cognitive Science
by Emily A. Holmes*, Ella L. James, Thomas Coode-Bate, Catherine Deeprose' - Department of Psychiatry, University of Oxford, Oxford, United Kingdom
https://storage.googleapis.com/plos-corpus-prod/10.1371/journal.pone.0004153/1/pone.0004153.pdf?X-Goog-Algorithm=GOOG4-RSA-SHA256&X-Goog-Credential=wombat-sa%40plos-prod.iam.gserviceaccount.com%2F20210320%2Fauto%2Fstorage%2Fgoog4_request&X-Goog-Date=20210320T172221Z&X-Goog-Expires=3600&X-Goog-SignedHeaders=host&X-Goog-

https://www.psychologytoday.com/gb/blog/heal-your-brain/201203/can-tetris-prevent-ptsd-0

The colours for this game were also inspired by relaxing and calming colours that have been shwon to relax the mind, this is important for sleep. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80360135/111880085-36f99b80-89a1-11eb-851e-af68aa00102c.png)

Relaxing music has also been added into the game to push more of the senses into that 'sleep mode' 

Vimeo Demo can be found here:

https://vimeo.com/526574170
